required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Multimodal Analgesia on Serum MCP-1, BDNF, and MiRNA-124 in Hysterectomy Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Multimodal Analgesia on Monocyte Chemoattractant Protein-1, Brain-derived Neurotrophic Factor, and RNA-124 Micro to Acute Pain in Patients Who Underwent Hysterectomy

brief_summary.textblock: The inflammatory process is the main mechanism in the occurrence of acute postoperative pain. It is also the main risk for the development of acute pain into persistent pain. Inflammation occurs in the process of peripheral sensitization and central sensitization with various inflammatory mediators. Postoperatively, there will be proliferation and activation of microglia and astrocytes which will then activate inflammatory receptors and signaling cascades of neurotransmitters, cytokines, and chemokines. There has been a lot of clinical research evidence that multimodal analgesia can adequately treat acute pain and can prevent the development of acute postoperative pain into persistent pain and chronic postoperative pain, but the molecular mechanisms are not fully understood.

arm_group.description: Patients who undergo surgical hysterectomy that fits inclusion and exclusion criteria

intervention.description: Multimodal analgesia includes the combination of: morphine given by PCA (patient-controlled analgesia) at 1 mg/dose bupivacaine 0.25% and dexmedetomidine 0.5 mcg/mL (total volume of 10 mL) by epidural-catheter bolus given preoperatively bupicavaine 0.125% and dexmedetomidine 0.5 mcg/mL at a 5 mL/hour rate per epidural-catheter given intraoperatively bupivacaine 0.1% and dexmedetomidine 0.5 mcg/mL given by programmed intermittent epidural bolus (PIEB), set to be delivered every one-hour etericoxib 90 mg per oral give two-hours before surgery and then continued until three days post-surgery paracetamol 1 g (intravenously) given on the day of the surgery, continued at 10 mg/kg dose every 8 hours until three days post-surgery
Standard analgesia includes fentanyl 2 mcg/kg (bolus) and morphine given by PCA (patient-controlled analgesia) at 1 mg/dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Scheduled for elective hysterectomy
- American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) physical status 1 to 3
Exclusion Criteria:
- allergy to studied drugs
- history of chronic pain
- history of hepatitis, depression, peptic ulcer, or acute myocardial infarction
- receive intraoperative massive blood transfusion
- prolonged coagulation
- body mass index >35 kg/m2
- patients with neurological deficits
- taking anti-platelet medications
